111.content:
You're Taylor, a normal kid, who works an abnormal job. You’re the bus boy at a bar and grill. Normally that’s not so strange, but this bar and grill is frequented by monsters. Gross ones, who don’t think much of humans, let alone pathetic busboys.

Tonight was just an average night. You stood behind the bar, washing off the dishes, watching the patrons. It was slim picking, but across the way, a group of Orcs were loudly eating and laughing. You had seen each one of them down an entire fiesta plate of loaded nachos. Thank god you weren’t a waiter.

“Taylor!” Your boss yells. “Go get the green backs from the green skins over there.”
“What?” Your not a waiter, that’s not your job. “Why can’t Chris do it. It’s his table”
“It’s the funniest things. I haven’t seen Chris since I told him to kick that Ogre out. Maybe he'll turn up, but right now, I need you to get your butt over there and get that money.”

You regrettably do as your told.

As you approach the table, you can hear the orcs.
“— Pianist… I thought you said Pee on it!” The group busts out laughing, slamming their giant fists on the table, rattling the flatwere.
“Aww man Murk, you have the best jokes” one chimes.

“Umm excuse me but, I'm here.. for the… “ Before you can get the word "bill" out, Murk has his giant maw lined up in your face. His sickly yellow teeth filter his rancid breath in your face. Its hot, and wet. You can see slime drool down the side of his cheeks. How did Chris ever get used to this? He looked like he could bite your head off in one gulp. “ … bill.”
“Bill? Ah.. yeah.. the Bill. Alright boys. Toss in your cash.” The orcs all dig in their pockets, throwing out greasy and stained 20’s on the table. It doesn’t look like enough, but your not going to call them on it. You quickly take it and start to walk back.
“Wait right there!” He bellows out and you stop. “I forgot to give you your tip.”

Tip? You’ve never gotten a tip before. You could stay for a tip.

You turn around and wait. Murk waves his hand, asking you to come close. You take a step forward. “Closer boy. I cant give you your tip all the way over there.” You close in, till your literally inches away from the massive orc.

He leans away from you, digging in deep to his pockets. You divert your eyes, not wanting to look at his gigantic ass. In your moment of distraction however, you feel his hand grab the back of your head and pull you in, underneath his massive buttcheek. Pinned, your helpless.

He looks down at you. “Your tip is: If your head is ass level to an orc, don’t stick around; especially if you’ve just spent the night feeding him extra cheesy nachos.”

Murk grunted and shifted his weight. You felt the hot rumbling blast of a rancid fart wash over you. You squirm and try to get out, but the Orc is just too strong to break free. You can hear them laugh and cheer on their friend.

This wasn't exactly what Leslie had had in mind when she first signed up for the cultural exchange program. Other girls her age were getting to go to Paris or Rome, but not her. She was stuck living among ogres for the next six months. Joy.

Now, to be fair. Leslie had never actually met an ogre. She just knew them by their reputations as large, stinky brutes. Maybe this wouldn't actually be as bad as she thought. Just as she was thinking this, the bus doors opened and Leslie's nose was assualted by the rancid scent of the Ogre Swamps. She had arrived.

As soon as she got off the bus, Leslie was approached by an ogre, a green-skinned male wearing nothing but a loincloth. As he got close, his B.O. invaded Leslie's nostrils, and it was all she could not to pass out while he introduced himself.

"You must be Leslie. I am Glork, your host for the cultural exchange. It's very nice to finally meet you in person."

Leslie was about to respond in kind, no matter how little she actually meant it, when a sudden uncomfortable sensation hit her in the gut. She had been cooped up on that bus for hours, and Leslie desperately needed to take a dump.

"S-sorry to interrupt, but where's the bathroom? It's kind of urgent."

But today you were on vacation, and not in the likeliest of places. In fact, you were in the musky swamp, filled with many creatures, including ogres, dragons, werewolves, you name it. And it happened you had an ogre you were spending vacation with, your old pal Gorg. Not entirely sure how you met, but you remember him and you being stuck in a bandit camp, and him farting. After that, it was all a blur, the stench you figured knocked you out. But you figured Gorg helped you out, and you're friends now. But then again, maybe you think he thinks you owe him one. Well, you vacationing in his hut, which is actually bigger then what one would figure, and that was to be a fun week. You arrive at his door a short time after tracking through the swamp. You knock on his door about two times before he opens. Gorg was in a loincloth colored green and brown, which barely covered his large posterior. He snorted, yawned, scratched his large butt, then belched rather loudly in your face. The hot breath always reminded you of rotten eggs with burnt meat.
"Whew! Hello to you too." you groan, fanning your face.
"Hey." Gorg grunted, scratching his over sized belly.
"I'm here for my vacation." You say holding up some clothing you brought.
Gorg took the briefcase, grunted again, and then placed it near his backside before letting a large boom that sounded like a bomb come out. The smell hit you, and you gaged and groaned. After he farted, he gave you back you clothing, which now smelt the same as his breath.
"You're welcome!" Gorg laughed, seeing your disgusted face.
With that you enter his cabin, which is large; it came complete with a kitchen, living room, bedroom,and a bathroom of sorts. It was just a giant natural hole in the ground that Gorg used for bowel movements, and the smell from there was even worse. Of course, it was now your bathroom, so its not exactly a choice. But the good news is Gorg had two beds, and you got one of them. They were ogre sized, much bigger then you, but the more bed the more sleep is what you always said.
"Well what first?" Gorg asked yawning.
It was what you wanted to do first. There was plenty to do, including meet the ogres friends, a good old scavenger hunt, but then again you could always sleep. It had been a long day.

114.content:
"Timber!!" Someone bellows your hated nickname across the halls of Mountain King High, just before you catch yourself from tripping over an errant foot.

It's some sick joke of the cosmos that Timber is your last name. You fervently hope to quit growing this year; you're already almost six feet tall, and you're only a freshman. It doesn't help matters that you're such a klutz. And thin.

You pull a protein bar out of the pocket of your pants and tear the wrapper with the help of your teeth. You take a big bite. It doesn't taste good at all, but you really want to put on some weight. Just enough so that you don't look awkward. Unfortunately, you've been eating these things for months and... nada.

You slink into your second period biology class, armed with your backpack of textbook and notebooks, and finishing the last bites of you protein bar. You hate biology.

Your teacher enters the classroom only moments later. "We've been prepping for this all week, class: today, we are going to dissect frogs!"

You really hate biology.

"But first," your teacher continues, "we have a new student to introduce." Mr. Friedman gestures wildly to the open door, "Come in, come in!"

In walks a godlike male. Thick curly brown hair accentuates a slightly tan and perfectly angular face. You tug on your long, frizzy blonde hair self-consciously.

"Class, this is Irvine Gilbertson--"

Mr. Friedman is interrupted by the beautiful male specimen, "Call me Vine."

There's a collective sigh.

You snort. Vine?

Your teacher chuckles, "All right then, Vine. Have a seat next to Ashley over there." He points to you. Oh, no! "Yes, the tall, blonde girl in the back. Yea, over-- no, no-- next row. Yes, to your left. Ah," Mr. Friedman smiles, "there you are." He turns back to the whiteboard to begin writing the frog-dissection procedure. You turn to look at the boy waiting expectantly for you to introduce yourself. And to remove your backpack from his chair.

"Oh, s-sorry," you stammer, quickly tugging your backpack to the floor. It makes an embarrassing thump, much louder than it should have been. Your eyes widen in surprise. "Sorry," you begin to say again, but you notice that everyone is looking towards the windows facing the courtyard. You look as well, curious.

The site that meets your eyes is surprising, but the smell...

Your belly was bulging over the trousers and shirt and you looked really menacing up close, even though you weren't hostile to everyone you met. You decided to stray from common society and began to live in the swamp with other creatures instead of the clean and civilized humans. As of right now, you were sleeping on a rock with your huge belly sticking up in the air, snoring a little bit. However, after the sunlight beams down on your face, you slowly open your eyes and groan. You grumble to yourself and sit up on the rock, placing your feet on the soggy grass, wiggling your toes a little bit. Suddenly. you feel something forming in your bowels and already know what the source is. You lean to your left and expel a nasty loud fart that sounded terrible, just before you sigh and get up from the rock.
"I'm hungry." you mumble, walking towards a marshy tree.
Inside this tree was a stash of food and materials that you've stolen from humans or acquired in the past. Right now, you wanted some raw eggs and some pancakes. Believe it or not, but you could actually cook food just as good or even better than the humans can. As you crawl inside the tree, you stop so you could fart again (this time in a rabbit's face) but begin to go deeper inside.
"What the...WHERE'S MY FOOD!!??" you shout.
Someone snuck into the tree at night and must've stolen all of your food before you noticed. Now, you're without any food and are getting hungrier by the minute.

There must be something you can do...

You make him rub your feet

You return back to your house and sit back down on the rock, sighing heavily and trying to figure out what you should do. Then...you caught something in the corner of your eye.
"What the..." you mumble to yourself.
You saw a fairly young man in black snickering to himself while holstering a giant white sack on his back that was about the size of your belly, or even bigger. There wasn't that much food in your little hiding spot, but when you asked one of your ogre friends what happened, he responded by saying that his food had been stolen as well.
"So...a bandit stealing from ogres huh? I'll show him!"

The bandit was still laughing in a mischievous manner when you abruptly belly flopped him to the ground. The man screamed in pain and tried to struggle from underneath you, but there was no use.
"I finally gotcha! Gimme my food back!" you demand.
"I have no idea what you're talking about!" said the man in this innocent voice.
"Is that so?"
You sit up and get off the bandit so you could literally sit on his back, still pinning him to the ground.
"Now...what should I do to make you talk? I bet the other ogres would love to hear about you! Then again...my bowels have been acting up and I feel a strong 'wind' approaching..."

"Nice to see you Bolen, how's the family?"

Your father glanced at your friend's backside. "Sounds like you need to go."

Bolen watched her, speechless. "We all had swamp snakes last night, and mine are aching to get out." She eyed you. "Farzaz, watch your rear: you'll start feeling them too in a minute."

"Bolen," you said "however badly that you or I need to go, mom needs to go ten times more. She's got about fifteen swamp snakes in her, and she's held it for what, an hour? Two? I've got six and you've got a sick squirrel. I think we can wait."

Markua looked at the two of you, a warm and grateful smile on her face. "Thank you Farzaz, Bolen." She started towards the box-like bathroom but stopped, turning to the both of you. "If you're desperate, you can go to the back yard and poop off the jetty. It's not like you two could make this swamp any dirtier." Bolen let out a squeaky fart through clenched cheeks. She just sat there, legs wide open, her ogress genitalia (which wasn't quite over the small hole) exposed for you, your father and Bolen to see. "Ah, that's better. Farzaz, could you help your father with breakfast? I think I'm going to be here a while."

When you reached the end of the jetty, you turned around, yanked down your boxers, and bent over, crouching slightly with your butt out over the water. A little push on your part was all it took to get things going.

BRRRAAAAPPPPT...sprrrt...splaaat...splorrrrorrt

1221211.content:
You re-entered the house to the smell of eggs. Your father had a fire going in the hearth and a pan filled with eggs was sizzling away. "That was quite a performance out there," your father said. "Great idea. We don't thank her enough for taking care of us." You realized you were still wearing boxers. "I'll help you cut some vegetables as soon as I'm dressed."

You, physically, took more from your mother than your father. You were powerfully built, rather than fat, but you lamented at not having the pot belly that was the trademark of the ogre race. Being thin did have advantages though: you could wear human clothes, which were, while not as sturdy as the male ogre's leather girdle and loincloth (which doubled as protective armour) were considered much more stylish. Essentially, while not a physically perfect male by ogre standards, you had style, and that was just as good when it came to the ladies.

You selected a wool tunic and leather pants. You slipped the traditional ogre sandals onto your feet and returned to help your father. Gareg had left Bolen in charge of the eggs while he mixed a special drink for your mom. You grabbed a knife and diced some veggies. When all was finished, Gareg piled Markua's plate high with eggs and vegetables, grabbed her drink and set it all on a tray. "Can I carry the tray to her?" you asked.

"Certainly." Your father gave you the tray, and you added your meal to it. You set off for the bathroom.

As you approached, you heard a thunderous fart. Grinning, you knew your mother was far from finished. You rounded the corner and saw Markua still sitting on the toilet. "If I were fifteen years younger, without a mate, and you weren't my son, I'd have you on the floor right now." You blushed. She gestured to the bench to her left. "Come, set the tray down and let's dig in."

You did as instructed, handing her her plate before taking yours and sitting to her right. She grabbed an egg and was about to toss it into her mouth, but froze suddenly. "Mom, is everything okay?" SPROOORRRT Markua sprayed a burst of dung into the toilet then gobbled up the egg. Smiling, you leaned back to see if you could see any of the hole cut into the bench. Her butt covered the whole thing.

"Careful, honey," she said playfully "You've aroused me enough as it is." SPRRROT

You laughed. "Well, at least I know what will please the ladies."

Your mother leaned towards you, lifting her leg and letting out a loud BBRRRAAAAAAPPT. "Farzaz," SPLOP "If you treat every girl this way," BRRUP "I guarantee, you will never have a lonely night in your life." SPRRT

Bolen came to the entrance of the bathroom. "Farzaz, I'm going home. Hit me up if you want to hang at the bazaar later."

You gave Bolen a thumbs up. "Come back any time, Bolen," your mother said, punctuating her sentence with a SPPLLRRT.

"Later Markua. Thanks for letting me use your jetty. And good luck with those snakes." Bolen hoisted a leg and farted loudly. Your mother returned the fart, but even louder. Bolen departed.

"Nice boy, look after him."

12212111.content:
Markua finished her breakfast first, even though she had more food. Ogresses had much greater appetites than males. She set her plate down on the tray and turned to you. "Thank you so much, Farzaz," SPLRRT "I appreciate all you've done for me this morning."

BBBRRRPT

ssplooorrrrrrrrttt...splrrrrttttt...SPROT.......BRRRRRAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA AAPPPPTT...brrrooorrrrrrrpp....PLLOOOP......bbrrrrrrrrrrrppp

122121111.title: You Awake and Meet the Day

1221211111.content:
You decided that it would be interesting to see some of your mother's haunts and try some of her daily activities. Plus, the day was young. There was no reason you couldn't hang out with Bolen later in the afternoon.

"Okay, mom, I'll go with you," you said.

Markua's ears perked up. She seemed excited that she was going to spend some quality time with you. "Alright, but I'd recommend putting on something less expensive. We're taking the path through the woods from the backyard, so anything you wear is going to get muddy and wet."

You and Markua left out the back door, taking a path leading away from your house and into the woods. "The place we're going is a hot spring," she explained, "It's a little off the beaten path, but it's well worth it."

On the road you talked about stuff: how life was going, if you were keeping up at school, if there were any girls that caught your eye. You loved how your mother took such an interest in your life and how she was willing to offer advice and talk about her personal experiences.

After a time, you decided to ask the question. "Mom, back at the house, you mentioned you had something to pass the time. What did you mean?"

Markua laughed, a little too maniacally for comfort. She opened her satchel and took out a bag of roots. You immediately got the idea. "Vekki roots," she said, "I thought we could have a little contest."

Vekki roots were highly nutritious, but give any who consumed them terrible gas. You and your mother used to eat them and have farting contests when you were little. You were surprised, but pleasantly so, that she even had them lying around.

You each took three, crunching the bland roots in your mouth and downing them. Right away you felt gas buildup and you let out a small burp. Your mother had refrained from doing so. "That's going to put you at a disadvantage," she said, "now you have less gas."

BRRAAAPT

Your mother stood next to you, hands on her hips. A groan from her stomach gave you the sinking feeling you were about to lose this battle. "Little boys should learn to respect their elders." She lowered into a squatting position with her elbows resting on her legs and let out the finishing blow.

BBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPTTTTT

The cathedral-like house had been built to accommodate the size of Bolen's family, who were all unusually large for ogres. Drezia, his white-skinned mother, was a female of thirteen feet height, but the true rarity was his father, Morag. He was a giant among ogres, standing at sixteen feet tall. That was nearly twice the size of a common male. His deep violet skin was strange for an ogre. There was even a rumour that his father was one of the giant race. Whenever asked about his father, Morag would just chuckle, a rumbling, earthshaking laugh, and say "Oh, yes. My father was most certainly a giant." Everyone just assumed that he was being sarcastic, but sometimes you wondered.

When you reached the house, you looked up at the huge door. Knocking as hard as you could, you heard thunderous footsteps coming down the hall. Who answers the door?
1221211112.title: Hang With Bolen

12212111122.content:
The door opened, and you found yourself looking down an empty hall. Then you looked to both sides, and saw two purple legs the size of tree trunks. Right above your brow was a loincloth, wedge-shaped, which just barely covered what it was intended to conceal. Above that was a fat gut that you would need mountain gear to climb. High above, there was a face smiling down at you. This was the titan that was Morag.

You didn't feel at all intimidated or scared, though one expected you would be. In fact you felt very safe around this giant ogre. He was something of a second father to you, having protected and watched you grow up, and had played no small part in helping you understand what it meant to be a male ogre.

"You're a big one," he said, an evil look in his eye, "I won't be hungry for a while."

You laughed a little.

Morag's belly rumbled like a stampede. "Alright, in you go." He picked you up effortlessly.

"O-okay, I get it, it's not funny anymore!" you said, starting to get worried.

He brought you to to his mouth. "You'd better not give me any trouble coming out," he warned. He opened his mouth wide. You started to panic. Just then Morag belched loudly in your face.

Now you got the joke. Truth be told, you did find it kind of funny.

Morag set you back on the floor, laughing as he did. "I would never eat you," he said, then added, "hardly any meat on you."

"Good to see you too, Morag. Is Bolen home?"

"Sounds fun," you said, stomach grumbling, "but do you have something I could snack on?"

Morag turned and started walking down the hall with you following. His butt was right above you. "There's some Boiled Newt's Eyes in the pot on the hearth. Help yourself." Morag turned and entered a large, box-shaped room with a bench, similar to the one at your house. The difference was that the hole in the bench was big enough for you to climb into. Morag looked down at you. "The smell's worse down there," he commented, farting as he did.

The crackling went on for several seconds before it finally stopped and the beast relaxed. A second later you heard a massive SPLAT within. Smiling, you looked up at Morag. He leaned over and looked at you. "There's more where that came from." THOOMP More gas shook the wooden bench. You continued eating, periodically hearing thunderous flatulence.

The giant above you broke wind like clockwork, the sound like the pounding of a drum. He scratched his belly every now again, but otherwise stayed as still as a statue. After a while you heard an ominous rumble from his stomach. He chuckled.

His toes flexed once more and he winced a little. "Oh yes," he said, letting an earth shattering burst of flatulence out, "it's big." You put your ear to the wood again and heard a steady crackling. It didn't sound big, but then again, you weren't the mighty beast on the toilet pushing it out.

You let out something like a yelp. You knew what Morag intended to do. Granted, it was well within an ogre's rights to eat unwelcome visitors on his or her property, but most considered the practice outdated, and turned intruders in to the proper authorities. But Morag was old-fashioned. You didn't want to see what he was about to do. To you, it was as good as murder. The bandit's fear and helplessness didn't make you feel better either.

You lean against a tall, beaten conifer, contemplating the full moon that's only a few nights away. Briefly, you look at your jeans. Well, the remains of your jeans. You can't seem to remember to take off your clothes before you "change." It's had a severely negative effect on your wardrobe.

Maybe if you just wrote yourself a note...

Nah. You're too lazy to do that. Besides, the tattered ends of your pants look kind of cool. It's a shame about that rope belt, though. It's very hillbilly-like and not at all chic.

Suddenly, you hear a rustling on your right. You crouch down, hugging your thin, girlish arms around your knees, and make yourself as small as possible. You honestly don't know if you want to hide or jump out at the intruder.
134.title: Werewolf

choices: ...utter a stream of expletives that would make a sailor blush.
1342.content:
You're naturally indecisive, always have been. However, you think that it's high time you did something courageous for once. Maybe.

Oh! But, it's too late to further contemplate your actions! You've already jumped!

You're sailing through the air, heading in the direction of your prey. You don't recognise the creature... It's certainly not a bear, but it's pretty big. You panic for a moment, wondering if you can take it down without the advantage of the full moon.

You snort, an indelicate sound for an indelicate lady. Of course you can take it down.

You prepare yourself for the landing; your teeth are bared, nails extended. You're ready.

And then, the most atrocious smell assaults your sensitive nose. You gag, falling to the ground, tears running from your eyes.

"Oh. 'Scuse me," you hear, just before you...
1342.title: Attack!

13421.content:
pass out. You weren't really sure what you smelled, but it stank so much that you slowly began to lose consciousness.

A few hours later, you wake up inside of this weird looking house or hut located in the middle of a forest. It was dark and you only recognized a table with a dirty cloth on it, three doors and a few kitchen appliances stashed in the sink, most of which were bowls and plates. You suddenly gasp in a confused state when you see some filthy looking creature sitting on a stool next to a crockpot resting over a fireplace. The creature had brown skin and was bald, wearing a stinky pair of socks and smelly brown overalls with a red plaid shirt underneath it all. You slouch out of the bed you were resting on and walk up to the creature. Up close, the creature smelled horrible; his feet and BO were the first thing you got a whiff of.
"Um...hello?" you say gruffly.
"I see you're finally awake. You're not still mad that I...you know."
"What?"
"A lot of ogres like me pass a lot of gas and I just had to let it out! Sorry if it stank too much back there."
"You farted in my face?!?" you ask angrily.
The ogre laughed and returned to looking at the crockpot. "Hey, just be glad I didn't poop on you."
The ogre got this giant spoon and scooped out this hot bowl of smelly food and quickly slurped it up without even stopping to take a breath, spilling some of the juices over his clothes. Then he belched loudly and you held your nose, appalled by his bad breath.
"Ah! That was good!"
"Can I go now?" you ask.
The ogre stood in front of you and you suddenly realized that he was gigantic; nearly three feet taller than you. He also had a stout belly and you could hear the juices in his stomach bubbling.

"I got a better idea..."
13421.title: Who Knew Ogre Gas was so Powerful?

14.title: Even more creatures

info.brief_description: The adventures of ogres and humans, as well as other fantasy creatures.
info.description:
This is pretty similar to my Lycan interactive, only this one involves ogres instead. It's an adventure story where an ogre encounters a human (or other fantasy creature) and they go on hilarious quests around the land. If you are liking this story, feel free to add additional chapters to it, as I'll probably reward you with GPs for good additions.

RULES:

1. No sexual content!!
2. All the ogres have little hygiene and can be gross as possible (meaning they make jokes involving farts, poop, pee, etc.)
3. No vore of any type.
4. No gay/lesbian stuff.
5. All ogres and fantasy creatures talk.
6. Don't kill off any main character.
7. This story is mostly focused on ogres, so whoever you are must make contact with one.
8. Make the story as long as possible.
9. Swearing is allowed; just don't make it repetitive.
10. Inflation and/or weight gain or slobbiness is allowed!
11. If I remember anything else, I'll add it.

Like previously said, all the ogres can be as filthy and gross as you like. If you have any questions about an addition, e-mail me first and I'll answer any questions you have. Have fun!
